mem1brief:
Daljit S Sethi
  • Director, Aura Art eConnect Pvt Ltd
  • Director, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd
  • Chairman, Aura Art
  • Member, ICCR - Advisory Committee, Mumbai (Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India)
  • Chairman, Art & Culture, Spirituality & Leadership, Fund Raising – RI Dist 3140
  • Director, Art & Culture - RI Dist 3140 (2014-15)
  • Deputy Governor RI Dist 3140 (1998-99)
  • Founder & Chairman – Noble Heart Foundation
mem1detail:
• Significant focus on research, related to investing in Art, over the last 8 years, including creating awareness of Art as an asset class. Formulated strategy for Aura Art and closely involved in forging and maintaining alliances.
  • Working with Collectors, Corporates, Museums, Galleries and other stake holders to provide Art Infrastructure Solutions.
  • Providing Integrated Art Solutions to Realty Developers and Space Designers.
  • Worked with Ernst & Young/Andersen for 11 years (June 1997 to July 2008).  As an Associate Vice President, Transaction Advisory Services, over the last couple of years, primarily focussed on M&A and fund raising for players in Healthcare, Pharma, Biotech and Real Estate industry.  Prior to that, was part of the Global Tax Advisory Services team.
  • Educational background: 
    - Chartered Financial Analyst, US - AIMR, US (2000- 2003, awarded CFA Charter in 2004)
    - Chartered Accountant - ICAI (1997-2000, secured 32nd rank on all-India basis at Intermediate level)
    - Diploma in Business Finance - ICFAI, Hyderabad (1997) 
    - BCom from Narsee Monjee College (1997, overall 76%) 
    - ICSE from Jamnabai Narsee School (1992, secured highest in Maths: 99% & English: 94%, overall 90%)
  • Assisted a range of clients in identifying their investment objectives and designing (and periodically reviewing) a portfolio that achieves the objectives.  This involved asset allocation over a range of available options and selection of individual investments that complement each other in a portfolio to maximise returns, given the risk profile.
  • Authored a series of articles on Technical Analysis for a finance weekly, on specific buy/ sell/hold recommendations on stocks, over a period of one and a half years.
  • Involved in various community service projects, including teaching at St Catherine’s Home for 2 years, organising sports events/movies and Christmas celebrations for the children over the past 18 years, besides some Rotary and Rotaract projects.
  • Other interests include reading, writing poetry and meditation (practising Sahaj Marg system, offered through Shri Ram Chandra Mission, under the guidance of Shri Parthasarathi Rajagopalachari).
mem2brief:
Harmeet S Sethi
  • Director, Aura Art eConnect Pvt Ltd
  • Director, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd
  • CEO, Aura Art
mem2detail:
• An ardent Art lover. Has comprehensively studied Art and traveled extensively throughout India gaining finer insights into Art and Artists over the last 14 years. Relentlessly pursued quest for identifying high quality artworks and building deep relationships with artists across the country.
  • Largest contribution in building the enviable Aura Art collection over the last decade and in catalysing the development and promotional efforts of various artists.
  • Instrumental in conceptualising and administering nearly 30 shows over the last 6 years, across the country.
  • Managing family business of stocks and finance in Vadodara since 1995. Developed and successfully implemented trading techniques, relying significantly on Technical Analysis.
  • Was Gold medalist at Stock Market Operations programme conducted by Vadodara Stock Exchange Ltd in 1995.
  • Bachelor of Business Administration.
  • A Sportsman - was Captain of Junior Hockey team at school and played Lawn Tennis upto state level in Maharashtra. Has completed basic course in Rifle shooting conducted by Baroda Rifle Club.
  • Exhibits a deep sense of commitment and is very passionate about all endeavours he undertakes. A leader with high motivational and persuasive skills.
